intro: Dehaasia curtisii, commonly known as the Curtis's spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low shrub, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers clustered in cyathia. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with suitable climates.
